business.headline: India's Q2 GDP slows to 5.4%, hits 18-month low on weak consumptionThe weaker-than-expected GDP growth raises concerns about the sustainability of economic recovery, particularly as key sectors like manufacturing and mining face challenges.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as heavyweight stocks gain; Q2 GDP data in focusThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 759.05 points to 79,802.79 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 216.95 points to 24,131.10. Both the indices had declined roughly 1.5% yesterday.

PAN 2.0 FAQs: Who can apply, QR code feature, and other key detailsPAN 2.0 is a government initiative combining PAN and TAN systems with a QR code for secure and quick identity verification, simplifying taxpayer registration and promoting a tech-driven tax ecosystem.

Sensex surges 800 points: Key factors behind bull run on Dalal StreetStock market today: Sensex and Nifty regained their footing, driven by improved investor sentiment and stock-specific action. Read on to find out the key reasons behind today's rebound on Dalal Street.

Adani Green, Adani Energy Solutions: Why these Adani Group stocks are gainingAdani Green Energy led the surge, rising 14.64% to hit Rs 1,247.55. Adani Energy Solutions followed, reaching a day's high of Rs 825.85. Most other Adani Group stocks also registered gains in early trade.

Enviro Infra shares make strong debut, list at 49% premium over IPO priceEnviro Infra Engineers listing: The shares opened at Rs 220 on the NSE, marking a 48.64% jump from the IPO price of Rs 148. On the BSE, the stock listed at Rs 218, reflecting a 47.29% premium.

SpiceJet share price rises after Aircastle drops insolvency caseIn September, SpiceJet announced the resolution of a $23.39 million dispute with Aircastle (Ireland) Designated Activity Company and Wilmington Trust SP Services (Dublin) Limited.

Adani Total Gas share price jumps 16% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Total Gas share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 823.30 before settling at Rs 787, up 13.36% at 10:51 am.

Adani group stocks extend winning streak, rally up to 12% todayAdani Group stocks such as Adani Green Energy Ltd, Adani Power Ltd, Adani Energy Solutions Ltd, and Adani Enterprises Ltd gained as much as 12% after the recent clarification on the US bribery charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: As Trump threatens 100% tariffs, where India stands on Brics currency vs dollarAs Donald Trump threatened 100% tariffs on Brics nations, including India, if they went ahead with developing its own currency to replace the US dollar, India has adopted a cautious approach to de-dollarisation even as Washington recently became New Delhi's leading trading partner.

Eknath Shinde's comeback as Maharashtra in limbo, BJP finalises Chief MinisterBJP leader Raosaheb Danve hinted that the Maharashtra Chief Minister's name has been finalised, while a Shiv Sena leader said Eknath Shinde is expected to return to Mumbai today as government formation hangs in the balance.

Jolt to INDIA bloc as Arvind Kejriwal says no to alliance for Delhi pollsAAP chief Arvind Kejriwal said that the party will not form any alliances for the upcoming Assembly polls in Delhi, delivering a setback to the opposition INDIA bloc.

IND vs AUS PM's XI Live: KL Rahul-Jaiswal get India off to a strong startIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS) Prime Minister's XI warm-up game Live Updates: KL Rahul and Yashavi Jaiswal have come out to open for India in the chase vs Prime Minister's XI. Earlier, the hosts were bowled out for 240 in 43.1 overs as Harshit Rana picked up 4/44 in six overs. Akash Deep also picked up 2/58 in ten overs. Sam Konstas scored 107 while Hanno Jacobs also scored a crucial half century for PM's XI.
Lindt, who? Indian craft chocolates are stealing the show one bar at a timeWhy Indian craft chocolate brands deserve all the hype and love.

Cyclone Fengal kills 3 in Chennai, Puducherry sees highest rainfall in 30 years Live UpdatesCyclone Fengal live: Cyclone Fengal made landfall near Puducherry, where 42 cm of rain was recorded, the highest in 30 years and also led to flooding at several places, including Chennai, where three people were electrocuted.

Jay Shah takes charge as ICC President amid Champions Trophy tug-of-warJay Shah officially assumed the role of Chairman of the International Cricket Council (ICC) amid ongoing disagreements between India and Pakistan regarding the venue for the 2025 Champions Trophy.

India's love for golu-molu kids is feeding an epidemicMost Indians instinctively pull the cheeks of chubby babies. India's love for "golu-molu" kids is adding to the obesity epidemic. This is what's at the root of the love for overweight kids and how it is resulting in pre-onset diabetes and hypertension in teenagers.

Hyderabad bank manager saves elderly couple from Rs 30 lakh cyber fraudA vigilant State Bank of India (SBI) branch manager foiled a cyber scam targeting an elderly couple in Hyderabad's Lothukunta. Spotting signs of distress, he alerted police and prevented a Rs 30-lakh loss.

Video: Woman journalist mobbed in Dhaka, accused of being Indian agentBangladeshi TV journalist Munni Saha's car was intercepted by a group of people in Dhaka on Saturday. The mob accused her of being an Indian agent and a supporter of the former Hasina government.

Judicial panel in Sambhal to probe violence that occurred over mosque surveyUnder tight security, a three-member judicial inquiry commission headed by a retired high court judge visited Sambhal and inspected the area where violence occurred over the survey of the Mughal-era Shahi Jama Masjid.

The singer-actor also shared his love for Shah Rukh Khan, and the superstar has reacted to it.

Thanks for dinner: Trudeau's all-smiles pic with Trump amid tariff hike threatCanadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Donald Trump dined at the Mar-a-Lago residence in Florida despite the US President-elect threatening tariffs on Canadian and Mexican products over the drug crisis and illegal immigration across the US's borders.

Dua Lipa performs Levitating X Woh Ladki Jo, mashup creator Ruchir reactsDua Lipa's recent concert in Mumbai featured a viral mashup of her song Levitating with Woh Ladki Jo, surprising and thrilling the audience. The man behind the mashup, Ruchir Kulkarni, expressed his joy on social media, calling it the greatest achievement of his life.

Tipu Sultan a complex figure, politics of the day cherry-picks facts: S JaishankarExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar noted that contemporary history writings have largely focused on Tipu Sultan's resistance to British colonial control, while glossing over the adverse sentiments he evokes in many regions.

IndiGo crew member dances to Govinda's Chalo Ishq Ladaye with colleague in viral videoAn IndiGo crew member shared a video of herself dancing with a colleague to Govinda's hit song Chalo Ishq Ladaye on Instagram. The video has gone viral on social media.

Meet Kash Patel, Trump's FBI director pick who vowed to shut agency 'on day one'Kash Patel, 44, is the son of Indian immigrants and has had a diverse career in law and national security. A fierce critic of the FBI, he has pledged sweeping reforms if confirmed as director of the federal agency.

Raj Kundra gets ED summons days after raids in porn racket caseRaj Kundra was previously arrested in July 2021 by the Mumbai Police for allegedly producing and distributing pornographic content. Root achieved this milestone during England's dominant eight-wicket victory over New Zealand in the first Test at Hagley Oval.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
